intro: Wissadula pedunculata, commonly known as the coral tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red or orange inflorescences that resemble coral. The plant produces small, greenish flowers surrounded by fleshy, brightly colored bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Wissadula pedunculata is also valued for its ability to attract birds and insects due to its nectar-rich blooms.
